lead_paragraph: Though a lethal drone strike demonstrates progress against the militant group, ISIS has proved to be remarkably resilient and well prepared for the succession of key figures.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, Rukmini Callimachi from Rome, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Drone Strike Has ISIS Turning to ‘Deep Bench’
headline.main: Spokesman’s Death Will Have Islamic State Turning to Its ‘Deep Bench’

snippet: Though a lethal drone strike demonstrates progress against the militant group, ISIS has proved to be remarkably resilient and well prepared for the succession of key figures....
abstract: American officials warn that Islamic State group has deep bench of prospective leaders and already has in place plans to replace Muhammad al-Adnani, senior strategist who was reported killed in American drone strike in Syria; attack both underscores progress made in fight against group and group's resilience.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
